H0.text: What kind of singing, from the Italian for Manner of the Church, features singers without any musical accompaniment. Monophony

H1.text: What kind of singing, from the Italian for Manner of the Church, features singers without any musical accompaniment. Cappella

H2.text: What kind of singing, from the Italian for Manner of the Church, features singers without any musical accompaniment. Gregorian

H3.text: What kind of singing, from the Italian for Manner of the Church, features singers without any musical accompaniment. Acapella

A4.text: Music performed a cappella is music performed by a singer or a singing group without instrumental accompaniment.

A5.text: Gregorian chant is an example of a cappella singing.
